When considered together, the likelihood becomes extremely low due to the multiplication of their individual probabilities.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the information available up to my last update in April 2023, there's no strong indication that President Biden intends to drop out of the presidential race. His public statements and actions have consistently suggested a commitment to seeking re-election. While unforeseen circumstances such as health issues could potentially force a candidate to withdraw, as of my last update, there was no public information suggesting that President Biden's health or any other factor would necessitate his withdrawal from the race before July 13, 2024. Therefore, based on the information available and the general stability of his candidacy up to that point, it seems unlikely that he would drop out before the specified date.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the high legal bar, unprecedented nature, and the short timeframe, the likelihood of Donald Trump being removed or blocked under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment is low.

- For the ID political group: This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the factors of the number of candidates, primary and caucus results, party rules, and historical precedent, while there is a possibility of a brokered convention, especially with multiple strong candidates, the overall trend and historical context suggest this is less likely.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, given a brokered convention in 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Brokered Convention Scenario: A brokered convention implies that there is significant division within the Democratic Party regarding the presidential nomination, suggesting a strong potential for opposition to any move that seems to prematurely solidify a candidate's position, such as virtually nominating Biden early. 2. Existing Opposition: The Politico article indicates that dozens of House Democrats are already organizing to speak out against the early nomination plan, showing a substantial level of discontent. This existing opposition provides a foundation for the potential gathering of at least 20 signatures. 3. Rationale Behind Opposition: The reasons cited by Rep. Jared Huffman, such as stifling debate and concerns over Biden’s candidacy, especially in light of significant events like the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, suggest deep-seated concerns that could motivate a significant number of Democrats to take a public stance. 4. Resolution Criteria: The criteria allow for multiple letters and include both House Members and Senators, broadening the pool of potential signatories and increasing the likelihood of reaching the threshold of 20 signatures. 5. Time Frame: The resolution date of July 21st provides a window for organizing efforts to coalesce into a formal, public opposition, which is feasible given the initial draft of the letter has already been circulated. Considering these factors, there is a substantial basis for believing that, in the context of a brokered convention, the threshold of 20 signatures could be met. The existing opposition, the rationale behind it, and the inclusive criteria for resolution all contribute to a higher likelihood of the event occurring.

question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Then, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention, otherwise No.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Suarez's nomination would depend on his ability to raise his national profile, navigate Republican Party dynamics, and be perceived as the most electable candidate, especially under the specific conditions that might suggest Democratic Party divisions.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Additionally, at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early if, before the end of Sunday, July 21st, a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also meet this condition. This is based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico.

(2) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by the outcome of the 2024 US election day.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The combined improbability of a brokered Democratic convention, significant public opposition to an early Biden nomination, and Francis Suarez securing the Republican nomination makes the overall scenario highly unlikely.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering the Knicks' historical performance, the current competitive landscape of the NBA, and the factors that contribute to a team's success in the playoffs, it's reasonable to conclude that while they have a chance, it's not a strong one compared to more established contenders.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, being crowned the champion according to the NBA. Given this, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No for all other outcomes.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the United States is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves No if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider the relationship between the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals and the performance of the United States Olympic Team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The Knicks winning the NBA Finals is a specific event within the National Basketball Association, primarily involving professional basketball players. On the other hand, the Olympic Games involve a wide range of sports and athletes, many of whom are not professional basketball players. The success of the New York Knicks in the NBA Finals does not directly influence the broader range of sports represented at the Olympics. The Olympic medal count is determined by the cumulative performance of athletes across numerous sports, including track and field, swimming, gymnastics, and more. While the United States has historically been one of the top-performing countries at the Olympics, the outcome of a single professional sports championship like the NBA Finals does not significantly impact the overall Olympic medal standings. Furthermore, the condition provided (the Knicks winning the NBA Finals) does not inherently enhance or diminish the chances of the United States Olympic Team being the highest ranked at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The variables that contribute to success in the NBA (team dynamics, player talent, coaching, etc.) are distinct from those that contribute to success across the diverse sports represented at the Olympics. Given this, the probability of the United States topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, should be estimated based on historical trends of U.S. performance at the Olympics and not directly influenced by the outcome of the NBA Finals. Historically, the United States has been a top-performing nation at the Olympics, but the specific condition of the Knicks winning the NBA Finals does not provide additional information that would significantly alter the probability of the U.S. being the unique highest ranked team at the Olympics.

question.title: Given that the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), meaning they must not be eliminated from contention and must win the finals. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means the US team must have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. 

Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on historical dominance, investment in women's sports, and competitive trends, it seems plausible for one nation to win more than one women's team sport. However, the high level of competition, variability in team performance, and the spread of talent globally introduce significant uncertainty.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, and (3) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), meaning they must not be eliminated from contention and must win the finals. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means the US team must have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means that at least one NOC must have won gold in two or more of these events. The question resolves as **No** if any of these conditions fail to occur. Note: The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The combined probability of all three conditions being met is low, primarily due to the low likelihood of the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, compounded by the uncertainties surrounding the Olympic outcomes.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Kamala Harris being formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current Political Context: As of my last update in 2023, Joe Biden is the President of the United States, and Kamala Harris is the Vice President. For Kamala Harris to become President or Acting President, there would need to be a significant change in the current political landscape, such as President Biden's resignation, incapacitation, or removal from office. 2. Health and Incapacity: The health of President Biden is a critical factor. Any serious health issue could potentially lead to a situation where Vice President Harris might assume the role of Acting President. However, without specific information on President Biden's health, this remains speculative. 3. Impeachment and Removal: Another pathway for Vice President Harris to assume the presidency would be through the impeachment and removal of President Biden. This is a highly improbable event given the political makeup of the U.S. Senate as of 2023 and the high threshold required for such actions. 4. Resignation: President Biden's voluntary resignation is also a possibility but highly unlikely without a significant scandal or personal reason, neither of which is currently evident. Given these considerations, the likelihood of Vice President Kamala Harris being formally designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, is low. This assessment is based on the stability of the current administration and the lack of any clear indicators that would lead to such a significant change.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's break down the key components and analyze them step by step. 1. Understanding Core CPI: The Core Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the total change of consumer prices based on a representative basket of goods and services over time. It excludes food and energy prices, which are known for their volatility. The Core CPI is a key indicator of inflationary pressures within an economy. 2. Seasonal Adjustment: The data we are considering is seasonally adjusted. Seasonal adjustment is a statistical method for removing the seasonal component of a time series. This helps in understanding the underlying trend or pattern in the data that might be masked by seasonal fluctuations. 3. Historical Trends and Current Economic Conditions: To estimate the probability of the Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, we need to consider historical trends and current economic conditions. Historically, the Core CPI has shown a general upward trend, indicating inflation. However, the rate of increase can vary significantly from month to month. 4. Recent Economic Indicators: Recent economic indicators, such as employment rates, wage growth, and producer price indexes, can provide insights into potential inflationary pressures. Strong employment and wage growth can lead to higher consumer spending, which in turn can drive prices up. 5. Monetary Policy: The stance of monetary policy, particularly interest rates set by the Federal Reserve, can also influence inflation. Higher interest rates can dampen economic activity and reduce inflationary pressures, while lower interest rates can stimulate the economy and potentially increase inflation. Given these considerations, predicting the exact increase in Core CPI for July is challenging without the most current data on economic indicators and monetary policy decisions. However, based on the general trend of inflation and assuming continued economic growth, it is reasonable to anticipate some level of increase in the Core CPI. Probability: 0.7 This probability estimate reflects a general expectation of continued inflationary pressures, tempered by the uncertainty of specific economic indicators and policy decisions at the time of the prediction.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider the relationship between the US Core CPI increase and Trump's lead over Biden in the national polling average. The question is asking for a conditional probability, which means we assume that the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024. Economic indicators like CPI can influence presidential approval ratings and, by extension, polling numbers. An increase in CPI could indicate inflation, which might negatively affect the incumbent party (Democrats in this case). However, the impact of a single economic indicator on presidential polling averages can be complex and is mediated by many factors, including how the media and the public perceive the economy, the candidates' responses to economic issues, and other concurrent events. A more than 0.1% increase in the Core CPI might not be large enough to significantly sway public opinion or polling numbers on its own. The relationship between small changes in economic indicators and polling averages is not direct or straightforward. Polling averages, like those reported by 538, are influenced by a broad range of factors including, but not limited to, economic performance. Other factors such as campaign events, candidate popularity, external events (both domestic and international), and the methodology of the polls themselves play significant roles. The question specifies a very narrow range for Trump's lead (greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3). Given the volatility of polling averages and the multitude of factors that can influence them, predicting such a specific outcome is challenging. There is no direct causal link established between a small increase in Core CPI and a specific, narrow range of polling outcomes. The relationship between economic indicators and polling is complex and mediated by numerous factors. Given these considerations, predicting the exact impact of a more than 0.1% increase in the US Core CPI on Trump's lead over Biden in the polls within such a narrow range is highly speculative. The outcome is subject to a wide array of variables, most of which are not directly related to the CPI increase.

question.title: Given both (a) US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To address this question, we must consider the relationship between the conditions provided (US Core CPI increase and Trump's lead over Biden) and the potential for Israel to expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024. Firstly, the conditions provided (a and b) pertain to economic and political situations in the United States, which may not have a direct causal relationship with Israel's military actions in Rafah. The US Core CPI increase is an economic indicator related to inflation within the United States, and Trump's lead over Biden in national polling averages is a matter of US domestic politics. Neither condition directly influences or dictates Israel's military strategy or decisions regarding an invasion of Rafah. Secondly, Israel's decision to expand a ground invasion would likely be based on factors such as national security concerns, geopolitical considerations, the actions of Hamas or other militant groups in the region, and international pressure or support, rather than US economic indicators or the polling numbers of US presidential candidates. Given the lack of a direct causal link between the conditions provided and the outcome of interest (Israel expanding its ground invasion to Rafah), we must rely on general knowledge about the complexities of Middle Eastern geopolitics and the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is longstanding and complex, with periods of relative calm punctuated by outbreaks of violence. Israel's military actions in Gaza, including the possibility of expanding a ground invasion to Rafah, would be influenced by a variety of strategic, tactical, and diplomatic considerations, including the need to counter militant threats, manage international opinion, and navigate domestic political pressures. Without specific information linking the US economic and political conditions mentioned to Israeli military decision-making, it's challenging to predict with certainty how these conditions would influence Israel's actions in Rafah. However, given the general independence of Israeli military strategy from such US-centric factors, the probability of Israel expanding its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, based solely on the conditions provided, would seem to be relatively low, reflecting the lack of a direct causal link.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, let's consider the relevant factors and historical context. 1. Legal Context and Requirements: The trial concerns payments made to Stormy Daniels, and Trump's testimony could be crucial. However, whether he is legally required to testify depends on the specifics of the case and decisions made by the court. 2. Past Behavior and Public Statements: Donald Trump has a history of using legal avenues to avoid testifying in various cases. He often criticizes the legal processes and institutions that might compel him to testify, indicating a reluctance to do so voluntarily. 3. Potential Legal and Political Implications: Testifying could expose Trump to further legal risks, depending on his testimony. This might make him more inclined to avoid testifying if possible. Politically, testifying could also have implications for his public image and any future political aspirations. 4. Court's Power to Compel Testimony: The court has the power to subpoena witnesses, including Trump. If the court decides his testimony is necessary, he could be compelled to testify, either in person or remotely. 5. Negotiations and Settlements: Sometimes, cases like this can be resolved through settlements or plea deals that might avoid the need for certain testimonies. However, the specifics of this case and the willingness of both sides to negotiate would influence this possibility. Given these factors, while it's difficult to predict with certainty, the court's power to compel testimony and the relevance of Trump's testimony to the case suggest there's a possibility he could be required to testify. However, his past behavior and the potential implications of testifying suggest he might seek to avoid it if possible.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump testifies at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources. Then, will Israel carry out an attack attributed to them within Iran's borders that leads to the death of at least five individuals, as reported by credible sources, before May 1, 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: This question involves two distinct events: Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran. The connection between these events is not explicitly stated, but it can be inferred that the question is asking whether the occurrence of the first event (Trump testifying) will be followed by the second event (Israel's attack) before May 1, 2024. To estimate the probability of this question resolving YES, we need to consider the likelihood of both events occurring and the potential relationship between them. Firstly, regarding Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, it is difficult to predict with certainty whether he will testify or not. However, given the ongoing investigations and legal proceedings surrounding the hush money payments, it is possible that Trump may be called to testify. Secondly, regarding Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran, the tensions between Israel and Iran are well-documented, and there have been instances of military conflicts between the two countries in the past. However, predicting a specific attack that results in the death of at least five individuals before a specific date is challenging. There is no clear connection between Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Israel's military actions in Iran. The two events appear to be unrelated, making it difficult to establish a causal link between them. Given the uncertainty surrounding both events and the lack of a clear connection between them, the probability of this question resolving YES is low.

question.title: Given both Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The events described (Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran) do not have a direct connection to President Biden's ability to discharge his duties. The invocation of the 25th Amendment Section 4 is a significant step that requires evidence of the President's inability to perform their duties, typically due to health issues, not external political or military events.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, before May 1, 2024; (b) Credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals, between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024; and (c) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of all three conditions being met before their respective deadlines, let's analyze each condition separately and then consider their combined likelihood. (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial before May 1, 2024: Given the legal proceedings and the specific deadline, the likelihood of this event occurring is relatively low. Trump has a history of avoiding direct testimony in legal matters, often opting for written statements or seeking delays. However, the proximity of the deadline to the current date and the specific nature of this trial might compel his testimony. Probability for this event alone: 0.3. (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024: Tensions between Israel and Iran are ongoing, and such incidents have occurred in the past. The timeframe for this event is short, but given the volatile nature of the conflict, it's not implausible. Probability for this event alone: 0.4. (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: This is a rare and significant political event. The invocation of Section 4 of the 25th Amendment requires substantial evidence of the President's inability to perform his duties, which is not commonly declared, especially in a public manner. Given President Biden's current health status and the political implications of such a declaration, the likelihood of this event is low. Probability for this event alone: 0.1. Considering the independence of these events and their individual probabilities, the combined probability that all three occur before their respective deadlines is the product of their individual probabilities. Combined Probability = Probability of (a) * Probability of (b) * Probability of (c) = 0.3 * 0.4 * 0.1 = 0.012. Given the low probabilities of each individual event and the specific conditions required for the question to resolve as 'Yes,' the combined probability is quite low. Each event faces significant hurdles, whether they be legal, political, or based on historical precedent, making the overall likelihood of all occurring before their deadlines very small.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Assessing the likelihood of a terrorist act occurring during a high-profile event such as the 2024 Summer Olympics in metropolitan France involves considering various factors, including historical data on terrorism, current security measures, and the geopolitical climate. France has experienced significant terrorist threats in the past, and the Olympics will attract a large number of attendees, which may present an appealing target for such acts. However, the French government is likely to implement extensive security protocols to mitigate these risks. Given the unpredictable nature of terrorism and the high stakes involved, while the probability of a terrorist act occurring is concerning, it is difficult to assign a high probability due to the countermeasures in place. Therefore, I estimate a moderate likelihood of a terrorist act occurring during this period, but not overwhelmingly high due to the security measures that will be implemented. Overall, I would assign a probability of 0.35 for a terrorist act occurring during the 2024 Summer Olympics in metropolitan France.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The scenario is logically inconsistent due to the timeline, and there's no direct link between a terrorist act and EU trade policy decisions.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, which injures or kills at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between July 26 and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by an official French source. (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus having a brokered convention? The question resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is required, and **No** if only one ballot is needed.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's break down the components and analyze the potential impact of the given conditions on the Democratic Party's nomination process for the 2024 US presidential election. 1. Terrorist Act in Metropolitan France During the 2024 Summer Olympics: The occurrence of a terrorist act in France during the Olympics would likely have significant international implications, including potential impacts on global security policies and public opinion. However, its direct influence on the Democratic Party's convention process seems minimal unless it significantly alters the global political landscape in a way that affects the candidates' standings or the party's decision-making process. 2. EU Tariffs on Chinese EVs: The European Union imposing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles could have economic implications, particularly for global trade and the automotive industry. Like the first condition, this event's direct impact on the Democratic Party's need for a brokered convention appears limited. It might influence the party's platform or candidate positioning on trade and environmental issues, but it's unlikely to directly cause a brokered convention. 3. Brokered Convention: A brokered convention occurs when no candidate achieves the necessary majority (typically more than half of the total delegates) in the first round of voting, necessitating additional rounds. The likelihood of a brokered convention is more directly influenced by factors such as the number of strong candidates, the distribution of delegates among them, party rules, and the dynamics of the primary elections and caucuses. Given these considerations, the specified conditions (a terrorist act in France and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs) do not directly contribute to the scenarios typically leading to a brokered convention. The primary factors influencing the need for a brokered convention will be the internal dynamics of the Democratic Party, the number and strength of the candidates, and the outcomes of the primaries and caucuses. Therefore, without additional context or evidence suggesting a direct link between these global events and the internal nomination process of the Democratic Party, it's reasonable to conclude that the specified conditions do not significantly increase the likelihood of a brokered convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The assessment of each event indicates a low to moderate likelihood, but when combined, the overall probability decreases due to the compounding of uncertainties and low probabilities.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the strategic importance of the Crimean Bridge, the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, previous attempts to damage the bridge, and the military and technical feasibility of such an attack, there is a plausible scenario in which the bridge could be targeted before July 1, 2024. However, the enhanced security measures and the risks of escalation reduce the likelihood of such an event.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is the following true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If this occurs, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the current analysis, the most significant factors influencing Biden's candidacy would be internal to U.S. politics or personal reasons rather than a direct response to an international incident such as an attack on the Crimean Bridge, unless such an incident escalates into a major global crisis.

question.title: If both the Crimean Bridge is attacked and Biden drops out before July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following are true:
1. After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.
2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.
3. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If any of the first two conditions are not met, the resolution is N/A. If the first two conditions are met, but Asa Hutchinson is not selected as the nominee, the resolution is **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The probability of the Crimean Bridge being attacked is moderate but specific to a timeframe, making it harder to predict. Biden dropping out before July 2024 is low to moderate without clear indicators. Asa Hutchinson being selected as the nominee in a potentially crowded field, contingent on the other conditions, is low. Multiplying these probabilities together yields a very low overall probability.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack, (b) Biden drop out before July 13, 2024, and (c) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. (3) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering Iceland's mixed historical performance, the unknown quality of their 2024 entry, the unpredictable nature of Eurovision voting, and the potential for strong competition, a moderate probability of qualification seems most appropriate.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The above analysis highlights the complexities and uncertainties involved in predicting Eurovision outcomes. Given the lack of specific information about the 2024 contest and the inherent unpredictability of the event, the probability should reflect a balanced view that is slightly adjusted for Poland's historical performance and the competitive nature of the contest.

question.title: Given both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Iceland and Poland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final. If either does not qualify, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, it resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the information provided and understanding the qualification process of Eurovision, Georgia's qualification for the Grand Final is independent of Iceland and Poland's qualification. Without specific details about Georgia's performance or the competition in its semi-final, we can only estimate based on general historical probabilities of qualification from a semi-final.

question.title: Will Iceland, Poland, and Georgia all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Iceland, Poland, or Georgia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the historical performances of Iceland, Poland, and Georgia, the competitive nature of Eurovision, and the unpredictability of voting patterns, it's challenging for all three to consistently deliver top performances that guarantee qualification.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on OpenAI's expansion plans, the ongoing efforts to comply with EU regulations, and the flexibility in the definition of 'generally available,' it seems likely that ChatGPT will be available in the EU by the specified date.

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any categories indicating Russian control, including "Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives," "Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare," or any other categories indicating Ukrainian control or lack of Russian control.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The availability of ChatGPT in the EU does not have a direct impact on Russia's control over Chasiv Yar. The situation in Ukraine is dynamic, and control over specific locations can change over time. Given the current trends and available information, it is uncertain whether Russia will control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and that it is available to at least >50% of the population. This includes possible restrictions to certain countries or demographics, but the service remains substantially the same as OpenAI's general web interface for interacting with GPT models.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Control or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The provided conditions do not have a direct, clear-cut impact on the electoral success of the ID political group. The outcome of the elections will be influenced by a multitude of factors, including the group's policies, campaign strategies, and broader geopolitical and economic conditions. Therefore, a conservative estimate is appropriate.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (c) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The probability of all three events occurring is relatively low due to the uncertainty surrounding each individual event. The availability of ChatGPT in the EU is the most likely event, while Russia's control of Chasiv Yar is the least likely. The ID group's performance in the European Parliament elections is uncertain, but I've assigned a moderate probability.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's consider the context and the information provided in the prompt. The prompt mentions that there are already voices within the Democratic Party questioning Biden's chances of winning the 2024 election. This includes public statements from safe-seat members and endangered Democrats expressing doubt about Biden's prospects. It's noted that there are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, with at least one draft calling on Biden to end his campaign. This indicates a level of organization and seriousness behind the scenes to pressure Biden to drop out. For this question to resolve as YES, a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Biden to consider ending his campaign before July 20th. Given these points, let's assess the likelihood: The existence of both public statements and behind-the-scenes efforts to draft letters calling for Biden to step down suggests a significant level of discontent within the party regarding his candidacy. The fact that there are multiple drafts of letters indicates a level of seriousness and effort among those who want Biden to drop out. While having at least five named members is a specific requirement, the fact that there are already drafts of letters circulating and public voices of dissent suggests that it's plausible to reach this threshold. Considering these factors, it seems that there is a concerted effort within certain segments of the Democratic Party to pressure Biden to drop out. Therefore, the probability that a group of at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th is relatively high, given the context provided.

question.title: Given that both (1) at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering the potential impact of the specified conditions on market uncertainty and volatility, and acknowledging the complex interplay of factors that influence the VXVCLS, there is a plausible argument that the fulfillment of these conditions could contribute to higher volatility, as measured by the VXVCLS, on July 20, 2024, compared to the same date in 2023.

Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. (2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must be larger than Apple's. This is determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.
